name: Ensure LOB data types are not used
description: This rule checks the usage of LOB Storage in Oracle Database(s) and the explicit conversion functions TO_CLOB and TO_NCLOB which convert other data types to LOB data types.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: LOB storage is not supported by Aurora MySQL/PostgreSQL.
remediation:
Replace Oracle LOB data types with the following MySQL data types:
- BFILE can be replaced with VARCHAR (255)
- BLOB should kept as it is, because MySQL supports BLOB data type
- CLOB and NCLOB can be replaced with LONGTEXT

Replace Oracle LOB data types with the following PostgreSQL data types:
- BFILE can be replaced with VARCHAR(255) or CHARACTER VARYING(255)
- BLOB can be replaced with BYTEA
- CLOB and NCLOB can be replaced with TEXT
total: Number of SQL Tables and SQL Artifacts with SQL code
alternativeName: Ensure LOB data types are not used
